Event.0: The European Union was enlarged to include the new member states of Cyprus, the Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Slovakia, and Slovenia.
Event.1: Actress and model Bianca Jagger files for divorce from Rolling Stone rocker Mick Jagger after 7 years of marriage on the grounds of his adultery with model Jerry Hall
Event.2: Amtrak—the federally supported corporation that operates nearly all intercity passenger trains in the United States—began service.
Event.3:
Wes Anderson
American director and screenwriter
was born
Event.4:
Tim McGraw
American musician
was born
Event.5: The first major airplane hijacking within the United States occurred when a man forced a commercial airliner en route from Miami to Key West, Florida, to detour to Cuba.
Event.6:
Joanna Lumley
British actress
was born
Event.7: Orson Welles's Citizen Kane, considered by many critics to be the greatest film ever made, premiered in New York City.
Event.8: "Citizen Kane", directed by Orson Welles and starring himself, Joseph Cotten and Dorothy Corningore, premieres at the Palace Theater in New York City
Event.9: Empire State Building opens in New York City
Event.10:
Glenn Ford
Canadian-born American actor
was born
Event.11: American singer Kate Smith, known as the “first lady of radio,” was born.
Event.12: The Battle of Manila Bay ended in the defeat of the Spanish Pacific fleet by the U.S. Navy, resulting in the fall of the Philippines and contributing to the final U.S. victory in the Spanish-American War.
Event.13:
May Day founded
On this day in 1889, May Day—traditionally a celebration of the return of spring, marked by dancing around a Maypole—was first observed as a labour holiday, designated as such by the International Socialist Congress.
Event.14: US general strike for 8-hour working day begins
Event.15: Bob Rogers is acknowledged as the first American pro sports trainer when he is hired by the NY Athletic Club
Event.16:
Calamity Jane
American frontierswoman
was born
Event.17: The Great Exhibition of 1851 opened in London in the Crystal Palace, which was designed by Sir Joseph Paxton.
Event.18: Soldier William Tecumseh Sherman (30) weds Eleanor Boyle Ewing in Washington, D.C.
Event.19: First emigrant wagon train leaves Independence, Missouri, for California
Event.20: Women's rights activist Elizabeth Cady Stanton (24) weds fellow abolitionist Henry Brewster Stanton (34)
Event.21: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's opera "Marriage of Figaro" premieres in Vienna with Mozart himself directing
Event.22: Publication of Species Plantarum by Linnaeus, and the formal start date of plant taxonomy adopted by the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature
Event.23: Acts of Union comes into force, uniting England and Scotland to form the United Kingdom of Great Britain
Event.24: Stefan Batory, the reigning Prince of Transylvania, marries Anna Jagiellon and they become the co-rulers of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth.
